attributes.action: Call another EU referendum for those aged 16-30
attributes.background: What should have been done previously and what should be addressed now, is the importance of the generation whom the EU referendum would effect. Therefore it is my request that as a generation, we should be given the choice, rather than our elders making that choice for us.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Count non-voters as a vote for the status quo in referendums.
attributes.background: People who vote do so to express their choice.  By not voting, people are saying they are not really concerned either way.  If they held a strong conviction they would have voted.  Change should not be imposed without taking these non-voters into account.
attributes.additional_details:
The in-out EU referendum is a case in point. Fewer than half the voting public voted for change but change will happen because insufficient people voted for the status quo.

Non-voters who weren't really concerned, or who didn't vote because they thought the status quo would win, should have their 'vote' counted.

To make a significant change (eg leaving the EU) more than half of the voting public should vote for it, ie not half of the voters.

attributes.action: Allow 15,16 and 17 year olds to vote in a second referendum.
attributes.background: The generation of people who were not allowed to vote will be the ones who are most affected by the change. Therefore they should be allowed a say in their future by having a vote in a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of 18-24 year olds voted remain, this shows that the young people of our population want to stay and should be given a chance to make this happen.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Get better broadband speeds in SE16.
attributes.background: I live in London (SE16) and have very low broadband speeds that aren't acceptable. At the moment I can get up to 2.6mbps (download) and 0.4mbps (upload). Living in the middle of London, you would expect to get fibre optic lines or have at least 10mbps.
attributes.additional_details: We keep being told that we will get better speeds soon. "Soon" seems to never happen as I've been hoping for better speeds since 2012.

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its £534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: Give grandparents the same funding as foster parents whether they work or not
attributes.background: Payment for grandparents who have grandchildren fulltime.
attributes.additional_details: Me and my husband work but can only get child benefit for 2 grandchildren who live with us fulltime so if they need clothes or shoes or anything else and it is more than £34 we have to pay for it. I think there should be some sort of payment like foster parents get because grandparents are doing the same job.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: Make Helium Balloons Illegal
attributes.background: I am always seeing helium balloons. Helium is a limited resource so should not be used for balloons, especially as helium can be used for important MRI scanners. This gas is lighter than air and will never be seen again if it floats away. So please support me in my hope to ban helium balloons.
attributes.additional_details:
When pressure becomes too much for a balloon it will pop, and the foil balloon will land in the ocean- a innocent sea creature will eat it and die.
Helium is a limited resource and is needed for MRI scanners to work. Helium is the only element out of all 118 in the periodic table that can cool the electromagnets to the right temperature for the scanner to work. One day helium may save your life.

attributes.action: Limit the resale of event tickets to a maximum of double the face value
attributes.background: Recently I have attempted to purchase tickets for my favourite artists, only to find that they are sold out in seconds.  If this was by genuine fans, then I'd understand. However, its not.  Immediately on checking Stubhub, there are hundreds available that people are buying to make profits from.
attributes.additional_details: Adele tickets, Face Value £123.00 selling for over £1500 on stub hub within 12 minutes of the sale going live.

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of £25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Introduce £50 charge for calling an ambulance for non-emergency conditions.
attributes.background: The answer to over-crowded A&E and queueing ambulances isn't more money, it is to stop people using ambulances as a taxi service or for minor ailments. The ambulance crews have to treat you if you call them but too many people are abusing this service. A charge for mis-use would cut own demand.

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Amend voting age to reflect the school year
attributes.background:
This petition aims to grant the right to vote to second-year college students; in other words, to 17-year-olds who will pass their 18th birthday within the same school year as the vote.

We should recognise that students in the same school year have the same intellectual and cultural maturity.
attributes.additional_details:
To make an adequate generalisation about the societal and cultural awareness of young people, it would make much more sense to rely on their years of education; limiting voting by age is arbitrary.

For example, in the General Election 2015, students in their final year of college were only eligible to vote depending on whether their 18th birthday fell before or after May 7th. We should recognise that a period of a few days is inconsequential.

Colleges could then encourage youth participation.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Include Religious Studies as a Humanities subject in the English Baccalaureate.
attributes.background: The exclusion of RS from the EBacc is leading to a reduction in the overall understanding of religion in the UK, and suggests that RS is an unimportant subject. In a world increasingly defined by a lack of understanding of religious belief, this is a clear mistake by the Government.

attributes.action: Stop Dover Harbour Board dredging the Goodwin Sands.
attributes.background: Dover Harbour Board want to extract marine aggregate from the Goodwins. Home to 350 grey seals and the some 2,000 shipwrecks. We are already susceptible to erosion. Beach recharging works are constant. Flooding along the East Kent coast is continual problem which would be exacerbated by dredging.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a current petition to raise awareness, as detailed below.
https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/goodwin-sands-sos-stop-the-dredge
This has reached over 12,000 signatures.
Please help save the Goodwin Sands and their neighbouring environment from the destruction of dredging by signing this petition today and also by writing to the Marine Management Organisation with your concerns.
Letters can be emailed to marine.consents@marinemanagement.org.uk quoting the reference 
MLA/2016/00227.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Don't take prosecution powers away from RSPCA, give them more powers.
attributes.background: The Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee wants the Government to take away private prosecution rights for the RSPCA. Instead of taking away powers, we should be delivering the RSPCA more rights to be able to seize without Police needing to be present.
attributes.additional_details:
The RSPCA has a 92% conviction rate for cases that they take to the courts, this is more than the CPS.

The Environment Food and Rural Affairs Committee want prosecutions given to the CPS instead.

The RSPCA should have more rights to take animals rather than having to wait 24 hours, or calling the Police as animals could be going through torment whilst waiting for the RSPCA to return.

For emergencies that the Police call them too, they should be given some form of emergency lighting as it can take them hours to arrive.

attributes.action: Stop HS2
attributes.background: Stop HS2 destroying our green belt and countryside

attributes.action: Lower the sound limit of fireworks that can be sold to the public 50 decibels
attributes.background: A petition has recently gone around asking to ban the sale of fireworks to the public, and the response has been somewhat disappointing. As a compromise we are asking to lower the sound limit from 120 to 50 decibels to minimise stress on animals and people.

attributes.action: Clamp down on the tax loop holes for contractors and limited companies.
attributes.background: Certain contractors are avoiding tax by paying corporation tax at 20pc and taking a modest wage plus dividends from the company, they save on income tax and National Insurance contributions. Some are also able to keep child benefits because their “wage” is under the threshold.
attributes.additional_details: Throughout the course of my career I have seen a major shift in work employment, from employees moving from being permanent PAYE to self employed or contracting predominantly for tax benefits. If we continue down this path of legal tax avoidance, soon there will be nobody permanently employed, declaring a full salary and paying their tax in relation to their actual earnings.  Some individuals are actually qualifying themselves for child support by declaring low salaries. This is morally wrong.

attributes.action: Prevent companies from automatically opting us in to third party marketing.
attributes.background: When calling various service providers such as car insurance companies, housing insurance, mobile phone companies there is often a prerecorded massage at the start of the call stating that they will pass on your details to third party companies for marketing purposes, you need to ask to be opted out
attributes.additional_details:
Having spent 20 minutes online trying to get car insurance quotes and speaking to 1 company who had a similar pre recorded message that was unable to provide the required service I have been plagued by sales calls trying to sell me similar and unrelated products due to being automatically opted in.

This practice is wrong and parasitic, if companies want to sell or benefit from marketing your details they should be the ones asking, the burden to opt out should not be placed on the consumer.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Restrict all heavy lorries with speed limiters to one lane on motorways.
attributes.background: As heavy vehicles are fitted with speed limiters, overtaking can take several miles and cause congestion and tailback to vehicles without speed restrictors.
attributes.additional_details: The effect is to cause congestion and tailbacks to other motorway users.

attributes.action: Minimum 3 month driving ban and £1k fine if caught using a mobile phone driving.
attributes.background: Using a hand held mobile phone while driving can have the same consequences as drink driving. Drivers caught not using hands free devices should be subject to a minimum 3 month driving ban and a minimum £1000 fine. The only way we can try and stop this is by imposing tougher laws.

attributes.action: Lower the curfew of fireworks to 9pm on a normal night
attributes.background: The curfew for fireworks should be lowered to 9pm on a normal night because little children go to bed at 9pm & dogs will not be afraid for too long & their owners will be able to get to sleep not worrying about there pets.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Never sign a trade deal like CETA/TTIP which cede UK sovereignty to corporations
attributes.background: Once Brexit has completed, the UK will be able to enter into trade deals by itself. Ministerial support for TTIP/CETA which are aimed at eroding national sovereignty and giving multinational corporations the right to sue governments if policy adversely effects their profits is a serious danger.
attributes.additional_details: The main tenet of the Brexit campaign was to "take back control" from the EU. UK ministers have voiced strong support for CETA/TTIP which seems contradictory given that such trade deals put the sovereignty of government in doubt and give corporations the ability to sue governments under Investor-State Dispute Settlement powers before special international tribunals. This would effectively bring an end to the cherished principle of equality before the law, all in the name of greater profits.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.
attributes.background: We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: Give English People a vote on if we want Scotland to be given independence.We keep hearing how Scotland wants its independence and how harsh it is being a part of the United Kingdom. As well as how unfairly Scotland is treated buy the rest of the UK they seem to forget about all the English money that is used to help and support Scotland. So i propose we have a show of hands to see how many people in the rest of the UK would want to become separated from Scotland. I think that Scotland would be shocked at the result of this partition

attributes.action: removal of traffic commissioners powers to suspend, revoke driving licences
attributes.background: when you get an offence like an TS10 and after you have paid the fixed penalty and received the points, you are called up to the traffic commissioner nearly 3 years after the fact and she decides to suspend your licence while under a high court ruling this can only happen for a maximum of 21 days.
attributes.additional_details: the traffic  has suspended licences for 22 years according to DVLA they have had letters from VOSA through the traffic commissioner to suspend a licence until the holder is 70 years of age under current law this can only be done for a maximum of 21 day through a high court ruling or 12 month through the totting up of more that 12 penalty points

attributes.action: To change the education system to ensure all students benefit
attributes.background:
What needs to be done: 
-	The amount of memorization needed to do well in the subject needs to be reduced.
-	Courses should focus more on coursework due to the stress of exams.
-	The core subjects need to be changed in order to benefit the child outside of qualification.
attributes.additional_details:
A focus on memorization leads to a bias towards students who have a good memory, but not necessarily a good understanding. The amount of information needed to memorise has recently been increased by Ofqual.

Coursework has recently been removed completely from all non-practical subjects. This increases stress drastically to the point where it may have physical effects. Many students also struggle to perform under stressful conditions which means they do not get results that reflect their ability.

attributes.action: Compensate overseas pensioners re post Brexit drop in the Pound.
attributes.background: We, pensioners aged 72 & 79 (ex RAF- now 70% disabled)  left Britain in 1991 to go and live in France. After 19 years we joined our daughter in Germany. We know about fluctations of the Pound, but enough is enough. Since the referendum we have lost around 100 E every 4 weeks and it's getting worse!
attributes.additional_details:
My husband receives a Basic Pension (85%) and attendance allowance payments 4(weekly) , I receive the married woman's part of his pension.
The first payments after  the referendum were minus 92 Euros and with each subsequent payment the minus has increased. It's shocking. I can supply details if required.

attributes.action: A standardised requirement for motor vehicle headlamps in lumen and colour.
attributes.background: Many are finding it increasingly difficult to drive at night due to the variations in lighting strength and colour. Often it is very difficult to differentiate a dipped headlight from the full beams. These are wreaking havoc with people's vision potentially causing accidents as they are dazzled.

attributes.action: Prevent reverse charging on mobile phone contracts unless consent is given first
attributes.background: The current laws allow anyone with your mobile number, who sets up a business through the regulator, to charge you too "Receive" texts that cost you money without your consent.  Some of these are on the proviso that you opt-out of something you haven't even requested.
attributes.additional_details:
It should not be possible to charge you to receive texts until the user has opted-in, by responding to a text message instead of just receiving it, and mobile network operators should be forced to disable reverse charge billing if requested by the bill payer.

Mobile network operators should also be made to publish their involvement in these companies as well as the profits that they make from them as there is clearly a conflict of interest.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 “The natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.”  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Smoking Should be Banned on Outside Station Platforms (Especially Merseyrail)
attributes.background:
"Smoking is permitted on our surface stations" - Merseyrail.org

Merseyrail allow smoking on their surface (i.e. outside) platforms. This is a disgrace! Platforms can become very congested with people and thus causing others to inhale second-hand smoke, including children and pregnant women.
attributes.additional_details:
One might argue that smoking is okay as it is still considered outside. However on the street people have the option to cross the road or move away whereas, at a station platform passengers do not have this option and instead must inhale second-hand smoke. 

London Overground stations prohibited smoking on surface platforms. Merseyrail is clearly behind modern times. If London has adopted this policy then why hasn't Merseyrail?

It is of this author's opinion that the Health Act 2006 should be amended so that smoking should be banned on any train platforms in England.

attributes.action: We want a government run school bus system similar to America's.
attributes.background: As a student I understand the ridiculous bus prices which we have to pay to even go to school. I believe that as we have a right to education it is wrong that parents have to pay up to £12 a day For us to go school. As well as this students who ride on private coaches have to pay up to £300 a year.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a student who has three siblings going to the same school. His mother has to pay £8.85 each day just for her children to go to school. 

I believe that the American system of having government run school buses is greatly superior to our system now.

I understand like most things in this world this will cost money, my suggestion is to raise council tax by £1-3 and use that money to set up a government run bus system. There are 27 million households in the UK, meaning £81 million a month.

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Make the supplier of broadband supply the speed you should get and pay for
attributes.background: I should get 200 meg but only get 57 meg like most people on the supplier forum

attributes.action: Give employees rights post-probation so they can't be unfairly sacked
attributes.background: I was recently dismissed without my boss following disciplinary procedures. Employees only get job protection after two years, making it easy for SMEs to dismiss staff for unfair reasons. The law needs updating to protect the millions of people employed post probation until they reach two years.
attributes.additional_details:
On the Gov.UK website it states - Before taking any action, your employer should: follow disciplinary procedures or give you a chance to improve 

Small businesses accounted for 99.3% of all private sector businesses at the start of 2015 with 15.6 million people employed by SMEs. After seeking legal advice on the subject ACAS disciplinary procedures only apply after two years. So small businesses do not need to apply these and can unceremoniously make it easy to dismiss staff.

attributes.action: Introduce Entry Level Apprenticeships
attributes.background: We would like to initiate a scheme that allows access to entry level apprenticeships for those who may not achieve a level one qualification, Entry level apprenticeships would give these young people a future within well paid , skilled vocational jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Many young people find school a difficult learning experience, some have the disadvantage of a learning disability, ASD, mental health issues  and or EHC plans which are not fit for purpose, as some young people's progression is slower and requires additional support. Some just have talents that are more vocational. Not everybody is naturally gifted at Maths, English and Sciences.
However, the system works to add to their disadvantages by favouring those who are more academic. It is very difficult for these young people to gain access to an apprenticeship because these require a level 1 grade,on completeion, in numeracy and literacy.
